intro: Campulosus gracilis, commonly known as the slender campulose, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
